Name.creator: Solinus, C. Julius, 3rd cent.?
Author: Vibius, Sequester, 4th/5th cent.
Title: Solinus (C. Iulius) De situ orbis terrarum [et] de singulis mirabilibus quae in mundo habentur. Uibius Sequester De fluminibus montibus lacubus [et] gentibus : prouinciarum totius orbis nomina ; ad nostra tempora redacta.
Description.note: At head of title: Haec continentur in hoc codice. Caption title, leaf [1] (3rd group): Vibii Sequestris De fluminibus fontibus lacubus nemoribus paludibus montibus et gentibus. Edited by Alexander Gaboardus. Imprint from leaf XXXIIII. Signatures: A⁶ a⁸ b-d⁶ e⁸, A-B⁴. Leaves printed on both sides. Capital spaces with guide letters. Verso of final leaf blank. "Tabula": leaf [2]-[5] (1st group) Errata: leaf [47]v-[48].|~|Spec. Coll. copy: Copious marginal annotations by Camillo Capilupi [?], with his signature "Camilli Gradi" at the end, and note indicating price he paid for the book: "Emptu[m] 13 18". In old wooden boards, brown calf spine; modern leather clasps and ties; rebound by René Patron. Purchase, E.P. Goldschmidt, 1986.|~|Manzoni, G. Annali tipografici dei Soncino, no. 70 Adams S-1390 BM STC Italian, 1465-1600, p. 632|~|"Tabula": leaf [2]-[5] (1st group).|~|Errata: leaf [47] (verso)-[48].
Description.abstract: An annotated copy of De situ orbis terrarum ... [Polyhistor] by the 3rd or 4th century grammarian and compiler, C. Julius Solinus. This 1512 edition has been extensively annotated by Camillo Capilupi.
